summary: This bill, the 25th Anniversary of 9/11 Commemorative Coin Act, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins to mark the 25th anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attacks. It specifies coin denominations ($5 gold and $1 silver), design requirements (including "Never Forget" inscription and consultation with the National September 11 Memorial and Museum), issuance timeline, sales prices including surcharges, and how the surcharge revenue will be directed to the National September 11 Memorial and Museum. The bill also includes financial assurances to ensure no net cost to the government.
